They will also develop Smart Operation and Management framework for DJB.

348.title: CNG price in Delhi hiked by ₹2.5 per kg, to now cost ₹66.61 per kg
348.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Wednesday. CNG will now cost ₹66.61 per kg in the national capital. For Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad, the CNG price has been hiked to ₹69.18 per kg. In Gurugram, it has been hiked to ₹74.94 per kg.

349.title: People think he's a skinny guy, can't hit: Plessis on Shahbaz Ahmed's 45(26)
349.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis praised all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed for his 45-run innings against RR, stating that the 27-year-old will play a "long part" this season. "People think since Shahbaz is a small skinny guy, he can't hit it long but he can smash it a long way," added Plessis. Shahbaz smashed 3 sixes and 4 fours in his innings.

350.title: Voice votes taken 200 times during passage of CA Bill in Rajya Sabha
350.article_body: Rajya Sabha saw voice votes being taken over 200 times for passage of a Bill on Chartered Accountants (CAs) on Tuesday. The debate on the Bill, including FM Nirmala Sitharaman's reply, took about two hours and 20 minutes and the process of voting took over 30 minutes. There were 106 clauses and clause-wise amendments in the Bill.

351.title: Eye-witness in Cong councillor Tapan Kandu's murder case found dead in WB
351.article_body: An eye-witness in Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder case was found dead on Wednesday in West Bengal's Purulia, police said. He was found hanging from the ceiling in his house, police added. The deceased left a note which stated, "I've been under mental stress since the day I saw Tapan's death...mental stress is aggravated by the repeated calls from police."

352.title: Told myself 'you'll go doing what you love': Tanuj on 'near-death experience'
352.article_body: Actor Tanuj Virwani said he felt "close to death" while filming underwater sequence during shoot for Abhay 3. "[Divya Agarwal] would be all 'We got this bro'...I would say yeah but in my head...I was thinking...'I don't know what's happening'...I just told myself, 'If this is how you have to go...at least you'll go doing something you love'," he added.

353.title: UK claims to have frozen $350 billion of Putin's war chest
353.article_body: British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said that the UK has frozen $350 billion of Russian President Vladimir Putin's war chest following the attack on Ukraine. "Our sanctions have had a crippling impact on those who feed and fund Putin's war machine," she said during her Poland visit. She added the sanctions are hurting the Russian economy.

354.title: Trump's supporters urge Musk to bring him back on Twitter
354.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's supporters are urging Tesla CEO Elon Musk to reinstate Trump's Twitter account after Musk became Twitter's largest shareholder. "Now that...Musk is Twitter's largest shareholder, it's time to lift...political censorship. Oh...and BRING BACK TRUMP!" Republican Lauren Boebert tweeted. Trump was permanently banned from Twitter following the US Capitol riot in 2021.

355.title: Mumbai gets its first transgender toilet in Goregaon
355.article_body: Mumbai's first public toilet exclusively built for the LGBTQ community has been set up in the Goregaon area. The project aims to provide a safe space for transgenders and prevent gender discrimination against them. "We request the government to construct more toilets like this one in other areas of the city," an LGBTQ member Manju, said while welcoming the move.

356.title: Electricity charges to increase in Bengaluru as KERC hikes tariff
356.article_body: The electricity charges for people living in Bengaluru will now increase as the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission (KERC) announced a 35-paise-per-unit increase in electricity tariffs for the next fiscal year (2022-23). "Against the demand of ₹1.85/unit by electric supply companies, the commission has increased the tariff by five paise per unit," Commission Chairman HM Manjunatha said.

357.title: Court denies bail to Jamia student in Northeast Delhi riots case
357.article_body: A Delhi court has denied bail to Jamia Millia Islamia student Meeran Haider in connection with a case related to 2020 Northeast Delhi riots. Haider, who is a Rashtriya Janata Dal youth wing leader, was charged under UAPA and sections of IPC. There are reasonable grounds for believing that the accusation against him is prima facie true, the court ruled.

358.title: Residents dump sewer waste at councillor’s office over inaction in Ludhiana
358.article_body: The residents of Ludhiana's Manjit Nagar dumped sewer waste in the office of Ward 47 Congress councillor Priya Kaira alleging inaction over multiple complaints. They were protesting against choked sewer lines in the area, which they claim had not been cleared out in four years. "One cannot even move through the streets due to the accumulated wastewater," a protestor claimed.

359.title: Amid Azaan row, B'luru Police starts seizing mics from places of worship
359.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around using loudspeakers for Azaan, Bengaluru Police have started seizing microphones from places of worship that allegedly defied noise pollution orders of court. Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said that the police have booked cases and that the drive will continue to keep a check on prescribed decibel levels. He also said action will be initiated.

360.title: Had 4 months of training, spent 4-5 hrs a day playing cricket: Shahid on Jersey
360.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he underwent four months of training for his upcoming film 'Jersey'. "We started in Bombay and began playing on hard surfaces. We started with throwdowns. I used to spend four-five hours a day playing cricket for four months and then [a lot] on set [too]," he added.

361.title: Vidya would say a line, go to a room and have tears: Director on 'Jalsa' scene
361.article_body: 'Jalsa' director Suresh Triveni said that actress Vidya Balan cried after filming a scene that involved her yelling at her on-screen son. "Every time Vidya would say that line...she'll...come near the monitor, go inside a room...she would have tears...I remember when I met Surya later after the shoot, and the first thing he said was 'Vidya ma'am cried," Suresh added.

362.title: Karthik shifted momentum our way, it made it easy for me: Shahbaz
362.article_body: RCB all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed, who scored 45 off 26 against RR, has said the wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik shifted the momentum in the game with his 23-ball 44-run innings and it also made it easy for him to bat. "The situation was a little tough because the momentum was with RR...But DK bhai shifted the momentum," he stated.

363.title: 48,000 mask-less Punekars penalised, ₹1.90 crore fine collected in 2 yrs
363.article_body: Over 48,000 people were penalised for flouting COVID-19 mask rules in the last two years in Pune. Reports said that ₹1.90 crore fine was collected in two years. The penalties included people who were caught spitting on the roads. Officials said that the highest imposed penalty during the pandemic for these offences went up to as high as ₹1,000.

364.title: Hrithik, rumoured girlfriend Saba party with Sussanne and Arslan in Goa, pics surface
364.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad partied together with Hrithik's ex-wife Sussanne Khan and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni in Goa. Pooja Bedi shared pictures from the party, which also saw Sussanne’s siblings Farah Khan Ali and Zayed Khan in attendance. Hrithik and Sussanne had tied the knot in 2000 and had separated in 2014.

365.title: Am I Vijay Mallya or Nirav or Ambani, Adani: Raut mocks ED for attaching his property
365.article_body: After ED attached Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's properties in a ₹1,034-crore land scam case, he mocked the agency, saying, "Understand the meaning of property. Am I Vijay Mallya, am I Mehul Choksi?" "Am I Nirav Modi or Ambani, Adani? I live in a small house. I don't have a single acre of land in my native place," he added.

366.title: 24-yr-old Army aspirant runs 350 km in 50 hours from Rajasthan to Delhi, clip goes viral
366.article_body: A 24-year-old Indian Army aspirant named Suresh Bhichar ran 350 km in 50 hours from Rajasthan to Delhi. "I have come from Rajasthan's Nagaur district. I have a passion to join the Indian Army," he said. He added, "Recruitment hasn't taken place for 2 years. I have come to Delhi by running to increase the enthusiasm of youth."

367.title: China reports 20,472 daily COVID-19 cases, highest since start of pandemic
367.article_body: China reported 20,472 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, the highest daily tally since the start of the pandemic. Shanghai remains the hotspot for the current surge, despite a sweeping lockdown of its 25 million people. There were 311 local infections and 16,766 asymptomatic cases in Shanghai, and another 973 infections and 1,798 asymptomatic cases in Jilin, a northeastern province.

368.title: Pak PM's wife's friend flees amid corruption charges; her '$90,000-bag' pic goes viral
368.article_body: A friend of Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi has reportedly fled to Dubai amid allegations of corruption. A photo of Farah Khan travelling in luxury, with a bag near her feet, surfaced on Twitter, however, its date isn't clear. "The bag with her is for $90,000," Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz Member Romina Khurshid Alam tweeted, sharing the picture.

369.title: Railways to begin Bengaluru to Tumakuru MEMU train services from April 8
369.article_body: The South Western Railways will run Mainline Electric Multiple Unit (MEMU) trains on Bengaluru-Tumakuru line from April 8 to facilitate office-goers, officials said. "The train will leave from Tumakuru at 11:15 am and arrive at Krantivira Sangolli Rayanna at 1:25 pm and depart from KSR at 1:50 pm and arrive at Tumakuru at 3:40 pm," a Railways officer informed.

370.title: Congress, that imposed Emergency, is crying for democracy today: Shah
370.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing the House over the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, said, "Congress, the party which imposed the Emergency, snatched all democratic rights, sent Opposition behind bars for no reason, strangled freedom of the press, and censored Kishore Kumar's songs, is crying for democracy today." He added that those who forget history, become history.

371.title: Criminal arrested with AK-47, 1,300 cartridges in UP's Shamli
371.article_body: Shamli Police in UP arrested a man from the Thanabhawan area and recovered an AK-47 rifle along with 1,300 rounds of cartridges which the accused bought for ₹11 lakh. He is a member of 'Anil Banji’ gang. "The arrested criminal is being interrogated to know how a weapon like AK-47 was smuggled and from where," Shamli SP, Sukirti Madhav, said.

372.title: Haryana CM Khattar withdraws VVIP number series from his convoy
372.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced the withdrawal of VVIP number series 0001 of four vehicles of his convoy. All the numbers will be available for the general public through e-auction, he added. "A revenue of ₹18 crore will be earned through e-auctioning...The money can be used for the welfare of the public," Khattar stated.

373.title: 2 arrested for assaulting, looting BSF sub-inspector in Gurugram
373.article_body: Two men were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly assaulting and looting a BSF sub-inspector. According to DCP Virender Vij, the suspects had offered a lift to sub-inspector Arvind Bagaria to drop him to Delhi. However, when they reached near Guru Dronacharya Metro station, one of the suspects moved to the back seat, assaulted Bagaria and looted his luggage, police added.

374.title: 5 domestic workers steal cash, jewels from employer's farmhouse in Ludhiana
374.article_body: Five domestic workers reportedly fled with cash and valuables worth lakhs from their employer's farmhouse in Ludhiana's Sarabha Nagar Extension while they were on a pilgrimage. "The accused...broke open the iron grill and glass of the store...broke the safes and stole cash...gold and silver jewels," the complainant said. According to police, the businessman had hired them two years ago.

375.title: New range of Hitachi split ACs comes with ambience light feature & Wi-Fi
375.article_body: Hitachi's new range of split ACs with advanced Japanese technology are unique and inspired by nature, stated the brand. The ACs are equipped with an immersive display called ambience light, which turns blue at a temperature of 16-23℃  indicating cool ambience, green at 24-27℃ for comfort and red at 28-32℃ to indicate warm ambience.

376.title: Gadkari, Raut, Maha MLAs attend dinner at Sharad Pawar's home in Delhi
376.article_body: BJP leader Nitin Gadkari, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut and Maharashtra MLAs attended dinner at NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Delhi. Pawar invited Maharashtra MLAs for the dinner, as the leaders from all the parties are in Delhi for a training program in Parliament. The MLAs also attended a tea party at Raut's residence in the evening.

377.title: I can't point out one moment where we lost the game vs RCB: Sanju Samson
377.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said he can't point out "one moment" where they lost the game against RCB on Tuesday night. "I thought it was a great effort to put up that total on such a slow wicket...Jos and Hetmyer batted brilliantly at the death," he added. This was RR's first loss in three games so far in the tournament.

378.title: Pune University students to get training as tour guides at Buddhist sites
378.article_body: Students at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will get training and on-field experience of working as tour guides at Buddhist archaeological sites. The Department of Archaeology and Museums, Pune has agreed to provide training to students enrolled in postgraduate diploma course of Buddhist Heritage and Tourism. About 10 students in the first batch will be doing a three-month internship.

379.title: Man forces lover to sell house, threatens to leak intimate videos in Pune
379.article_body: A 40-year-old woman has lodged an FIR with Pune Police, stating her father's friend who was in relationship with her since 2012, forced her to sell her house and siphoned off money. She also stated that he made videos of their intimate moments and later used them for blackmailing her. The accused reportedly threatened to post videos on social media.

380.title: Germany sees surge in distribution of images of child sex abuse
380.article_body: Although overall crime rate fell in Germany in 2021 compared to previous year, the country witnessed a 108.8% surge in distribution of images of child sex abuse, said the government on Tuesday. "Combating sexual abuse of children and dissemination of heinous abuse photos and videos via the internet is a top priority," said German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser.

381.title: Being in the industry can take a toll; you need to have perfect skin: Priyamani
381.article_body:
'The Family Man' actress Priyamani said being in the industry can take a toll on an artiste. 
"You need to have perfect skin, dress, and hair because you'll be photographed at any time. Although people need to know that it's just for half an hour," she said. "It's okay to have imperfections. It's absolutely normal to have flaws," she added.

382.title: No state reported confirmed death due to oxygen shortage during COVID: Govt
382.article_body: Union Minister of State for Health Bharati Pawar on Tuesday told the Parliament that no state or UT has confirmed any death due to a shortage of oxygen during the COVID-19 pandemic. "Of the total, 20 states and UTs have responded but none of them reported confirmed death due to oxygen shortage," Bharati added.

383.title: 4 leopard cubs rescued and reunited with their mother in Pune
383.article_body: Four leopard cubs, found in a sugarcane field in Kabadwadi village of Pune, were reunited with their mother by forest department officials. The cubs, including two male and two female, were spotted by farmers while harvesting cane in the village. After medical examination the cubs were placed in a safe box from where their mother took them away, officials added.

384.title: 167 accidents, 78 deaths recorded on Pune roads in last three months
384.article_body: Pune traffic police have recorded 167 accidents in city between January and March 2022. Meanwhile, in same period of time, deaths of 78 people in road accidents have also been recorded. Reports said highest number of deaths were recorded in areas under Sinhgad road traffic police division. Police data said that there are 19 accident-prone black spots in the city.

385.title: KTR inaugurates 1st facility of Jamp Pharma outside Canada in Hyderabad
385.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Tuesday inaugurated the first facility of Jamp Pharmaceuticals outside Canada in Genome Valley in Hyderabad. "The facility is designed to cater solid oral dosage form, powders, topicals, nasal delivery and liquid oral pharmaceutical products for regulated markets," he tweeted. "The facility is being established with a total investment of ₹250 crore," KTR added.

386.title: SC stays order barring Arya Samaj from issuing marriage certificates
386.article_body: The Supreme Court stayed a Madhya Pradesh High Court order which asked Arya Samaj to follow provisions under Special Marriages Act for weddings and barred it from issuing marriage certificates. The petitioners challenging the high court order argued that Arya Samaj had been solemnising weddings according to Vedic rituals for over a century before the Hindu personal laws were enacted.

387.title: If you sing 'dirty lyrics', Punjab people won't let you eat at dhabas: Jasbir
387.article_body: Singer Jasbir Jassi said that he can't sing 'dirty lyrics' of songs. "Punjabis will beat me up. The atmosphere in Punjab today is such that if you sing really dirty lyrics, people won't let you even eat at dhabas," he said, adding, "I owe it to Punjab...I have to take Punjab and move forward, we are connected to our roots."

388.title: 3 persons held in Ahmedabad for cheating job aspirants of ₹3 cr
388.article_body: Ahmedabad Police’s Crime Branch team arrested three persons and busted a racket that allegedly cheated 81 people to the tune of ₹3.24 crore by promising them government jobs. Police recovered several application forms, exam admit cards, police ID cards, uniforms, gadgets and cash from them. The accused gang had created a specific rate chart of “assured postings in government jobs".

389.title: Intel suspends all operations in Russia, calls for 'return to peace'
389.article_body: Intel has announced the suspension of all its operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. "Intel continues to join the global community in condemning Russia's war against Ukraine and calling for a swift return to peace," the firm said. It added that it's working to support all of its employees through the conflict, including its 1,200 employees in Russia.

390.title: Getting rid of spam higher priority: Binance CEO on Musk's Twitter poll
390.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao in response to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's Twitter edit button poll said, "Getting rid of spam is probably [a] higher priority. Protect users." Earlier, Musk had posted a poll asking his followers if they wanted an edit button. Last year, Zhao and Musk argued on Twitter after Musk called Binance's handling of its Dogecoin glitch "shady".

391.title: Sonia Gandhi meets Congress MLAs from Maharashtra in Delhi
391.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday met with a delegation of around 22 party MLAs from Maharashtra at her residence in Delhi. The MLAs reportedly expressed concern over lack of coordination within the Congress legislature party. "The meeting held with Sonia Gandhi was based on present political situation of Maharashtra and how to strengthen the party," said MLA Vikas Thakre.

392.title: I was unable to move my hand, took painkiller injection: Rishabh Pant on Sydney Test
392.article_body: Recalling the Sydney Test in India's 2-1 Test series victory over Australia in 2020-21, Rishabh Pant said he injured his elbow in the first innings and was unable to move his hand. He added that he took a painkiller injection as he had to bat "by hook or by crook". Pant scored 97 runs in the second innings.

393.title: I am not done yet: RCB's Dinesh Karthik after scoring 44*(23) against RR
393.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 44 off 23 deliveries to help RCB defeat RR, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "I've made a conscious effort this year to do justice to myself because last year...I felt I could've done better." He added, "I'm making a conscious effort to tell myself that I'm not done yet." The 36-year-old was named 'Player of the Match'.

394.title: Elon Musk refiles Twitter stake disclosure to show he's an active investor
394.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk refiled the disclosure of his stake in Twitter to classify himself as an active investor, after he was appointed to the company's board. Earlier, he had filed a disclosure showing a passive stake of over 9% in Twitter, meaning he wouldn't seek change at the company. His stake ownership makes him Twitter's largest shareholder.

395.title: Heat wave warning issued for 12 states/UTs over 5 days, list released
395.article_body: The IMD has issued heat wave warning for 12 states and UTs over five days. Heat wave to severe heat wave conditions are likely over Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Haryana, Delhi, Madhya Pradesh, Jammu and Himachal Pradesh. Maharashtra may witness heat wave from April 5 to 7. Gujarat, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and Bihar are likely to witness heat wave today.

396.title: Policeman records video of woman taking bath in Gurugram, suspended
396.article_body: A head constable of Gurugram Police has been suspended for allegedly recording a video of a woman while she was taking a bath, police said. The incident took place on April 3 when the accused passed by carrying a bucket, police added. "There is no ceiling between bathrooms. He was recording a video from an adjacent bathroom," the woman said.

397.title: Civilian killings in Ukraine's Bucha disturbing, need independent probe: India at UNSC
397.article_body: At the UNSC meeting on Ukraine addressed by Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, India's TS Tirumurti said, "Recent reports of civilian killings in Bucha are deeply disturbing. We unequivocally condemn these killings and support the call for an independent investigation." UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres said he will never forget the "horrifying images of civilians killed in Bucha".

398.title: India reports 1,086 new COVID-19 cases, 71 deaths in 24 hours
398.article_body: India has reported 1,086 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,198 recoveries, and 71 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 71 deaths reported today, 63 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,871, while the death toll reached 5,21,487.

399.title: Twitter confirms it's working on an edit button, says 'we weren't joking' on April 1
399.article_body: Twitter has confirmed that it's been working on an edit feature since last year and it will test the feature with Twitter Blue members in coming months. It said that it didn't get the idea from a poll by Elon Musk, Twitter's largest shareholder. "Ps: we weren't joking," Twitter said about its April 1 "working on an edit button" tweet.

400.title: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa revokes state of Emergency
400.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa late on Tuesday night revoked the state of Emergency with immediate effect on his island nation. This comes after Rajapaksa's ruling coalition lost its majority in Parliament as proceedings began on Tuesday and at least 41 lawmakers walked out of the alliance. Notably, Finance Minister Ali Sabry resigned a day after his appointment on Tuesday.
